title: United States: Grand Canyon delays opening of North Rim due to snowfall
description: Park officials are pushing back the opening from mid-May to June 2 to give them time to plow the main state road that leads to the North Rim. It has received more than 250 inches of accumulated snowfall since October.

title: Burkina Faso: 44 civilians killed in two villages by 'armed terrorist groups'
description: Others were wounded in the attacks which targeted the villages of Kourakou and Tondobi in northeast Burkina Faso overnight Thursday, according to the lieutenant governor of the Sahel region.

title: At least 24 migrants die in waters off Tunisia over 2 days
description: The number of migrants launching from Tunisian coastal waters and aiming to reach the shores of Italy has skyrocketed this year.

title: After K-pop, K-food is conquering France
description: With its decorated dalgona candy and its kimbap rice and vegetable rolls, Korean food is making is becoming a fixture.

title: Between Macron and Borne, cracks start to show
description: The prime minister appeared to distance herself from the president, causing a PR scramble in both of their teams. Some in the governing coalition fear that her potential departure would lead the government to shift right.

title: Five months before the Rugby World Cup, the  organizing committee adopts a social charter
description: A few months after the World Cup in Qatar, which was marred by controversy, French Sports Minister Oudéa-Castéra has insisted the tournament should be exemplary.

title: Bruno Bischofberger, the man who married Basquiat to Warhol
description: In 1982, the Swiss gallery owner, who had represented the prince of pop art since the late 1960s, organized a meeting between the two artists. In Paris, the Fondation Louis Vuitton is presenting half of their 'four hands' collaboration until August 28.

title: Christophe Cognet: 'Film offers an exercise in looking'
description: The director explains how he worked to make a film from the clandestine images of Nazi camps.

title: 'From Where They Stood': Following the trail of clandestine photos taken from Nazi camps
description: With precision and discretion, director Christophe Cognet reconstructs the history of the rare images taken by prisoners in Nazi concentration camps

title: In Peru, rural Indigenous youth are the primary victims of police and military repression
description: Since December 2022, demonstrations calling for the resignation of President Dina Boluarte have expanded, triggering lethally repressive measures that have claimed mostly younger victims.

title: On the Rhône river, strikes against pension reform bring navigation to a halt
description: The union for the company that manages the river has been blocking locks since March 16. Barge operators remain unsure if they will be compensated.

title: Hundreds attend funeral of Russian pro-war blogger killed in bomb attack
description:
Maxim Fomin
, aka Vladlen Tatarsky, was killed in a Saint Petersburg cafe belonging to head of the Wagner Group, Yevgeny Prigozhin, who attended the funeral.

title: Israel calls up police and army reservists after Tel Aviv and West Bank attacks
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced reservists would be called up, after three people were killed in two attacks on Friday evening.

title: Studio Ghibli shaken by scandal involving its general manager
description: Toshio Suzuki, head of the Japanese animation studio known worldwide for films such as 'My Neighbor Totoro' and 'Spirited Away,' is accused of confusing his personal affairs with those of his company.

title: The key to Ukraine's counter-offensive: Breaching Russian lines
description: With trenches, minefields and 'dragon's teeth,' the Russians have fortified their lines, in  a sign of Moscow's concern about possible Ukrainian attacks.

title: Arizona's abortion clinic that won't give up
description: In the state of Arizona, abortion is still legal but subject to increasingly restrictive laws, while conservatives have opened a new front countrywide: the ban of abortion pills.

title: Macron and von der Leyen in China: A difficult but useful dialogue
description: The visit by President Emmanuel Macron and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen did not produce concrete results. But it was necessary to re-engage the relationship with Beijing, and doing so within a European framework was important.

title: 'Le Monde' correspondent expelled from Burkina Faso answers readers' questions
description: Sophie Douce and a fellow French reporter were both forced to leave the West African country, where the ruling junta is cracking down on press freedom.

title: MEP Pascal Canfin: 'Prime Minister Borne shouldn't have to pay for the broken pots'
description: The Macron supporter tells 'Le Monde' that the pension reform crisis is no reason to replace the prime minister, and criticizes 'the strategy of tension' carried out by Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin.

title: Canada repatriates 14 women and children from Syria camps
description: Canada said it was concerned for the 'health and well-being' of the children following 'deteriorating conditions' in the Islamic State camps. Three of the four women were arrested upon arrival.

title: Looting of Afghanistan archaeological site attributed to IS
description: Dilberjin, the largest ancient urban center in the north of the country, suffered irreparable damage between 2019 and 2021. The destruction is attributable to criminal groups tied to the Islamic State organization, using methods previously seen in Syria and Iraq.

title: North Korea announces testing of underwater nuclear attack drone
description: The official Korean Central News Agency said 'underwater nuclear attack drone Haeil-2... cruised 1,000 km' and 'accurately detonated underwater.'

title: France is a hub for wildlife trafficking
description: The illegal wildlife trade, one of the most lucrative in the world after drugs and arms trafficking, is one of the main drivers of biodiversity loss.

title: The scandal of UK prepayment gas and electricity meters
description: At the slightest late payment, energy suppliers in the United Kingdom forcefully install prepaid gas and electricity meters.

title: Soaring fees send music festivals into a spin
description: Organizers have to deal with the astronomical prices charged by stars, who are passing on higher concert production costs and increased competition with other events.

title: China launches military drills in Taiwan Strait
description: Taiwan's defence ministry said Saturday it had detected three warships and 13 Chinese aircraft around the island in the past 24 hours.

title: Conflicting court rulings plunge access to abortion medication in the US into uncertainty
description: US District Judge Matthew Kaczmaryk, a Trump appointee, ordered a hold on federal approval of abortion medication mifepristone in a decision that overruled decades of scientific approval.
